item.description:
How about a weekend at Stowe? As you may already know, Stowe is a premier resort in the Northeast with the best terrain and consistent snow.
From the legendary "Front Four" for advanced skiers to the gentle Toll Road the resort will please all levels and the effective ski terrain is big enough and lifts are well-thought and speedy enough that it never feels too crowded even on holiday weekends.
Here is the deal you may consider to purchase for $175 Per Person Dble: http://skicbsports.com/stowe-dec.htm and it includes:
 2 nights lodging, " Mountaineer Inn At Stowe "
 2 day all lift ticket at Stowe (regular price is $92 per day!)
 2 Continental Breakfasts
 discounted rentals and lesson
 Free shuttle service throughout the area
The Hotel features include indoor pool, hot tub, restaurant and tavern.
Live Entertainment at several location nightly nearby.
PLAN: (All Ideas are welcome!)
Friday
 Arrival
 TDB
Saturday
 Have breakfast at the hotel and meet around 8am at the mount
 4:15 meet at Matterhorn for Apre Ski/bite and a drink
 Chill at the Inn (relax in room, go swimming, or chill at hot tub or sauna)
 7:00pm Grab dinner at the restaurant the Inn or TBA
 TBD-TBD-TBD
Sunday
 12:30pm meet at lodge at the top of Four runner quad at Mt. Mansfield for lunch
OTHER ACTIVITIES
There is an excellent groomed x-country ski area in town. Ice climbing in Smuggler's Notch. Hiking (snowshoes can be rented). Mt. Mansfield is the tallest peak of Vermont and has magnificent views of neighboring high peaks of NY and NH.
Dog sledding: http://www.stowe.com/activities/dog_sled/
Snowshoe tour: http://www.stowe.com/activities/nordic/page...
cross country skiing: http://www.stowe.com/activities/nordic/cros...
